prompt.content: You are a derivatives investor.

Assume all contracts are for 100 shares. Answer with no explanation, only a classification. Given the expiration dates are the same, what is the name of the option strategy being implemented in the following? Sell 1 $205 strike price call at $5.00. Buy 1 $210 strike price call at $1.50.

data.sampled: : This is an example of a combination iron condor strategy, where the seller of the call options (in this case, the $103 calls) is hoping to profit from the underlying stock price remaining unchanged. If the stock price does not move significantly, the value of the $103 calls will decline due to time decay, while the value of the $104 calls will also decline but not as much due to the wider bid-ask spread. In this way, the seller of the $103 calls hopes to profit from the difference between the value of the $103 calls and the value of the $104 calls (which is typically around $1.50), while the buyer of the $104 calls hopes to profit from any potential price increase in the underlying stock.<|im_end|>
